doc.after: Applied physics is a general term for physics research which is intended for a particular use An applied physics curriculum usually contains a few classes in an applied discipline like geology or electrical engineering It usually differs from engineering in that an applied physicist may not be designing something in particular but rather is using physics or conducting physics research with the aim of developing new technologies or solving a problem
